definition: three-stroke form of Kangxi radical 94 犬[quan3]
first month of a season/eldest amongst brothers
to advance by leaps and bounds
(of water) to soar/(of prices) to skyrocket
to advance singing loudly (idiom); triumphant progress
fierce general/valiant military leader/fig. brave individual

sentences.english: A big thunder, lightning a good light, the wind is also very fierce.
sentences.chinese: 雷聲好大，閃電好亮，風也很猛。

sentences.english: Never jerk the horse's mouth while making any of the movements with the saber.
sentences.chinese: 當用馬刀進行每一次刺出時，不要猛拉馬的嘴。

sentences.english: Suddenly  he stopped  and  turned  around  and headed back.
sentences.chinese: 突然，他猛一剎車掉頭往回就跑。

sentences.english: I too haughty Shade also sing war, and a longer and greater one than any.
sentences.chinese: 我亦倨傲如宇也隨唱，戰爭更久更猛似乎不歇。

sentences.english: As I inhale the impalpable breezes that set in upon me.
sentences.chinese: 迎隱晦之風我猛吸氣輕風盪漾心旗。

sentences.english: Comfortable son fierce title, the eyeful tears looking at a side sits of woman.
sentences.chinese: 舒兒猛的擡頭，滿眼淚水的看着一旁坐着的女子。

sentences.english: The wind had got up again, and seemed sharpened by the thin sunlight.
sentences.chinese: 風又吹了起來，而且在微弱的陽光下彷彿颳得更猛了。

sentences.english: Emboldened, I yanked the strap of her backpack and then pushed her.
sentences.chinese: 我壯了壯膽，猛拽她揹包的帶子，然後往前一推。

sentences.english: After the feast the prince belched hugely.
I like lion eat, sleep and read books.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡猛喫，睡覺和讀書。

sentences.english: The dog bit him in the leg.
I swerved right and hit the curb.
sentences.chinese: 我猛向右轉撞上了路牙子。

sentences.english: Early morning - protesters plan to bang on the doors of delegates’ hotels
sentences.chinese: 一大早，示威者們計劃猛敲代表們就住的酒店的門。

sentences.english: The harder you chase them, the faster they run away.
sentences.chinese: 你追得越猛，他們就逃得越快。

sentences.english: When you stab yourself in the foot in hopes that it'll raise your rage bar faster.
sentences.chinese: 你猛戳自己的腳，希望能夠加快積攢一些怒氣。

sentences.english: His brothers ducked him in the river.
sentences.chinese: 他的兄弟們把他猛按入河水中。

definition: with all one's might/with sudden force/violently/to slam
to jump up suddenly/to bound up/to rise up in one bound
to swing (one's arms, a heavy object)/to wave (a sword, one's fists)/to fling (money)
